regulation_detail: The Port of Riga maintains year-round operability for navigation.

Riga Container Terminal (RCT) operates three berths with a length of 430 meters and a maximum draft of 10.5 meters, and BCT provides three berths extending 450 meters with a deeper maximum draft of 12.5 meters.
The overall management and operation of the Port of Riga are overseen by the Freeport of Riga Authority (FPRA).
CUSTOMER’s Application: CUSTOMER's request to provide ROT services, sent to ROT at least 5 (five) days before the day of starting the required ROT service.
If ROT service is provided on public holidays and holidays specified in the regulatory enactments of the Republic of Latvia – 2.0 coefficient shall be applied to the ROT Service tariff rates.

ROT’s maximum liability for the loss of Cargo above the permissible limit of Cargo losses or for damaged Cargo is equal to the value of the Cargo specified in the invoice...but not more than EUR 870.00 per package or unit or EUR 0.25 per gross kilogram of Cargo.

RCT has the right to suspend the provision of RCT services...if the wind speed exceeds the regulations of the Freeport of Riga (10 meters per second) or the air temperature is lower than -25 degrees Celsius, as well as in case of precipitation (rain, snow) if precipitation can damage Cargo.
The CUSTOMER is obliged to pay all invoices issued and submitted to it within 5 (five) Working Days from the date of receipt of the invoice.
Claims for which a General Form Act signed by the CUSTOMER and RCT...has not been drawn up shall not be recognized as valid.

source_document: Customs Declaration Report, Latvia Customs Information
regulation_detail: The Single Administrative Document (SAD) serves as the core customs declaration form for imports into Latvia from non-EU countries.

source_document: Customs Declaration Report, Latvia Customs Information
regulation_detail: Customs declarations are typically submitted electronically through the Electronic Customs Data Processing System (EMDAS) in Latvia.
Humanitarian aid consignments are exempted from customs duties in Latvia.
VHF Channel 9 shall be used for traffic organization within the Port of Riga VTMIS area.

Reporting is mandatory for vessels approaching, entering, navigating within, and departing from Port of Riga waters; specific reporting points are established for vessels entering or leaving the operational area.
Vessels must communicate with 'RIGA TRAFFIC' or 'SATIKSME' on VHF channels 09 or 16.
Trucker sits in line to enter the terminal gate as the first step in the container retrieval process.
Chassis Line: A separate queue or line within the container terminal where truckers wait to obtain a chassis (trailer) for container transport.
Truckers may wait for hours in the chassis line to obtain a chassis, contributing to significant gate processing time.
Man-hour (one working hour of ROT employee): EUR 25.00 (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Forklift with a lifting capacity up to 5.0t: EUR 30 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Fee for laytime of the ship at ROT Berths without performing cargo operations: EUR 0.001 per gross ton (GT) per hour, but not less than EUR 70.00 per ship per day.

Likely Required Documents for Container Arrival at the Port of Riga: Shipping line's Bill of Lading, Power of Attorney (POA), Container Arrival Notice, Cargo Manifest, Proof of Freight Payment, Commercial Invoice (Original), Packing List, Transportation Invoice, Certificate of Origin (Original), Customs Declaration (Electronic), Import/Export Licenses/Permits, Sanitary/Phytosanitary Certificates, Documents for Reduced VAT, Transit Documents (if applicable).

The CUSTOMER, delivering Cargo to the ROT territory (as custom's warehouse), submits to the ROT: Cargo customs documents; Cargo accompanying documents; Transport accompanying documents; documents confirming Cargo purchase - sale or Cargo owner and the value of Cargo; other information and documents necessary for completion or simplifying completion of customs formalities.

Prior to the commencement of ship loading (handling), the CUSTOMER is obliged to submit the following documents to ROT: Ships particulars; Bill of Lading (only if Cargo is unloaded from the ship); A copy of the ship's International tonnage certificate; Cargo Loading Order.
Essential Transit Documents for Latvia: Power of Attorney (PoA), Transport Document (CMR or BL), Commercial Invoice, Customs Transit Services Order (CTSO), Guarantee Policy.
Essential Transit Documents for Latvia: Power of Attorney (PoA), Transport Document (CMR or BL), Commercial Invoice, Customs Transit Services Order (CTSO), Guarantee Policy.
The Single Administrative Document (SAD) is composed of a set of eight copies, each with a different function.

regulation_subcategory: Import Documentation - SAD Details - Copy Functions
regulation_detail: SAD Copy No. 1: Retained by the Member State / Country where the export or transit formalities are carried out.

source_document: Customs Declaration Report, Latvia Customs Information
regulation_detail: Entry Summary Declaration (ENS): A pre-arrival security declaration that must be filed electronically prior to goods entering the EU customs territory.

source_document: Riga Port Report, Latvia Customs Information
regulation_detail: Shipments may be selected for inspection by Latvian Customs officials, involving document review and/or physical container inspection, particularly for high-risk shipments or goods requiring closer scrutiny.
Vessels must communicate with 'RIGA TRAFFIC' or 'SATIKSME' on VHF channels 09 or 16.

The vessel detention and release shall be carried out by the Harbour Master in accordance with the Maritime Administration and Marine Safety Law, Maritime Code and relevant legislation on the port state control procedures.

The Harbour Master in compliance with the provisions of Annex 2...shall establish the maximum permissible particulars of vessels (ship draft, length and breadth) within the port fairways, in specific port areas and at berths, taking into account the condition of the port water area...weather forecast and any other information on maritime safety.
e-mail address for CUSTOMER’s applications and exchange of operative information: rot.dispecers@rto.lv.

The amount of payment for unforeseen ROT Services...is formed by multiplying the actual time of provision of these services/downtime, the number of persons involved and the number and type of technical units, and special tariffs.
The time spent on customs formalities...must be excluded from Laytime.
The CUSTOMER is obliged to ensure that the ship leaves the ROT Berth within 4 (four) hours after the completion of loading/unloading of cargo and after completion of all relevant documents.
The CUSTOMER is obliged to submit to RCT the planned time of arrival of ships at RCT berths in the next month (Ship plan) no later than the 25th date of the month.
RCT ensures the completion of customs formalities in the clearance of Cargo, if Cargo is stored in RCT territory and if RCT and the CUSTOMER have not agreed otherwise.

The CUSTOMER is responsible for the accuracy and truthfulness of the customs documents, documents accompanying Cargo and additional information related to these documents, as well as the information on Cargo...submitted to RCT.
TIR Procedure: A customs transit procedure based on the TIR Convention of 1975, involving the use of TIR carnets as guarantee and control documents.

source_document: Transit Regulations Report, Latvia Customs Information
regulation_detail: Guarantee Policy: A financial security document typically required for transit shipments, serving as a guarantee for potential customs duties and taxes during transit.
New Computerized Transit System (NCTS) is used to track goods in real-time during transit through Latvia.
Trucker directed to the chassis line and waits, possibly for hours, for a chassis to become available.
Exit line at the terminal gate can be several dozen trucks deep on an average day, causing significant delays for truckers exiting the terminal.
Equipment Interchange Receipt (EIR): A key gate document that serves as the 'gate out ticket' when picking up a loaded container and the 'gate in ticket' when returning an empty container.
Forklift with a lifting capacity over 20.0t: EUR 45 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Mobile crane - manipulator: EUR 80 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
The CUSTOMER shall pay ROT EUR 0.03 per GT for the use of ROT Berths for each hour exceeded beyond the 4-hour departure time limit.
The fee for Cargo waste management [at ROT] is EUR 50.00 for each cubic meter of waste, but not less than EUR 50.00.

ROT is entitled to impose a fine of EUR 250.00 on the CUSTOMER for each case of non-performance or improper performance of the CUSTOMER's obligations specified in the Agreement, its annexes or General Conditions.
Customs clearance in Latvia can often be completed within 24 hours of the submission of all required documentation.

The Commercial Invoice for Latvian customs clearance must contain: names/addresses of sender/consignee, goods description, HS code, net/gross weight, quantity, price per item, total value, currency, packaging quantity, Incoterms, origin confirmation (invoice declaration/EUR certificate).

source_document: DHL Global Forwarding, Latvia Customs Information
regulation_detail: For businesses operating within the EU, an Economic Operators' Registration and Identification (EORI) number is usually required for customs clearance in Latvia.
The standard Value Added Tax (VAT) rate in Latvia is currently 21% and is levied on imported goods.
Goods that are in transit through Latvia are generally exempt from both Latvian import and export duties, as well as VAT.

ROT service “ship loading/unloading” is provided continuously (24/7) except on such public holidays of the Republic of Latvia: 1st January, 1st May, 4th May, Good Friday, Easter Sunday, Easter Monday, 23rd June, 24th June, 18th November, 24th December, 25th December, 26th December and 31st December.
ROT services regarding customs formalities are provided on Working Days from 7:00 to 21:00 and Holidays from 8:00 to 20:00.
Other ROT services are provided on Working Days from 8:00 to 20:00.

Unforeseen ROT Services are services (1) not specified in the Agreement...and CUSTOMER’s Application or (2) to be performed within the cargo handling...if the Cargo is damaged, has inappropriate packaging or similar and such Cargo cannot be transhipped using ROT technological schemes.

If ROT services cannot be started or cannot be fully and/or qualitatively provided due to the CUSTOMER’s fault...the CUSTOMER shall pay ROT for downtime. The downtime period starts from the 2nd (second) hour from the moment of sending the ROT’s notification.
The vessels being unloaded/loaded through RCT berths is serviced by a shipping agent nominated by RCT - SIA "Riga Port Agency"..., unless Parties agree otherwise.
NOR may be submitted to ROT on any day and at any time (including Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays (SSHINC)) (24 hours a day, 7 days a week).
The Laytime begins 12 hours after RCT has received the NOR, but not earlier than 14:00 on the first Laycan day agreed with RCT.

The time when the loading works has been stopped...when the wind speed is 10 m/s and more or...when the air temperature is below -25 degrees Celsius, or...when there is precipitation during which loading of Cargo is not possible/allowed...shall be excluded from Laytime.
The CUSTOMER is obliged to ensure that the ship leaves RCT berth within 4 (four) hours after the completion of loading/unloading of Cargo and after completion of all relevant documents.

Upon applying the transit procedure to goods which...are moved by rail..., the international railway consignment note set by Annex 1 to the Agreement on International Goods Transport by Rail of 1 November 1951 may be used as the transit declaration if the following conditions are met...

source_document: Latvia Customs Information, Transit Regulations Report (Implied)
regulation_detail: Types of guarantees accepted for customs transit in Latvia include: comprehensive guarantee and individual guarantee.

The customs office of departure or the authorised consignor shall determine the time period for the ending of the transit procedure of up to 40 days if...the transit procedure is applied to [specific HS Chapters] goods which are moved along rail in the time period from 1 November to 31 March.
Once entered [terminal gate], truckers input the information they are given for their appointment to retrieve the container.
Once they have a chassis, that passes inspection they head to the line to wait for their container.

Once they reach their container, they then wait on the crane to come to them and “pull” their container. There could be any number of hold ups that delay this. It could be hours to get the container mounted.
Once at the booth [exit gate], the attendant verifies all is in good order before letting the driver exit the terminal.
Forklift with a lifting capacity over 5.0t and up to 10.0t: EUR 45 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Frontal wheel loader with a bucket capacity up to 3.9m3: EUR 50 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Portal crane with a lifting capacity up to 20t: EUR 80 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).

document_type: Exemption Certificate Application Documents - Humanitarian Aid
regulation_detail: Documents for Duty & Tax Exemption Certificate Application for Humanitarian Aid Imports to Latvia: D&T Exemption Certificate (Original), Invoice (Original), AWB/BL/Other Transport Documents, Donation/Non-Commercial Certificates, Packing Lists, Power of Attorney (original), Certificate of Origin (original), Sanitary border inspection document (if needed), Import/export licenses (if needed), Documents for reduced VAT (if needed).

document_type: Application for Permit for Navigating in Port Water Area (AKOA)
regulation_detail: Documents/Information Required for Application for Permit for Navigating in Port Water Area (AKOA) at Riga Port: Application form (Annex 3), Knowledge Evaluation Test Minutes (Annex 3), Ship Particulars, Vessel Master's Details, and other supporting documents as per Harbour Master requirements.
The Port of Riga has strategically identified containerized freight, agricultural products, and timber as key areas for growth and development.
The Port of Riga's container terminals have a combined handling capacity exceeding 465,000 TEU annually.
ROT Services include Cargo transhipment.
ROT Services include Cargo storage.
ROT Services include freight forwarding.

source_document: Riga Port Report, Customs Declaration Report
regulation_detail: To engage in activities involving dangerous cargoes at the Port of Riga, port merchants are required to obtain a category B permit from the State Environmental Service.
For import of plant materials at the Port of Riga, an original Phytosanitary Certificate from the origin country is required for customs clearance.
For export of cultural objects from Latvia, a Permit CM-1 from the State Inspection for Heritage Protection is required.
For excise goods (e.g., alcohol, tobacco) transiting through Latvia, the Excise Movement and Control System (EMCS) is mandatory, requiring an Electronic Administrative Document (e-AD).

relevant_entity: Vessel Traffic Service Center, VHF Channels
regulation_detail: VHF Channel 9 shall be used for traffic organization. VHF Channel 67 shall be used by pilots. VHF Channel 14 is the Vessel Traffic Service Center reserve channel.
Vessel's (except for a small ship) maximum speed within Milgravis and Sarkandaugava Channels shall not exceed six knots.
Vessels shall not be allowed to drop their anchors...within the fairways' limits [of the Port of Riga].
Vessels with a maximum length exceeding 50 meters and more, as well as tankers and passenger ships, irrespective of their length, shall be subject to compulsory pilotage at the Port of Riga.
Provided there is an emergency or disaster in the Freeport territory, a berth operator shall immediately notify the State Fire and Rescue Service, using the single emergency call 112...
Forklift with a lifting capacity over 5.0t and up to 10.0t: EUR 45 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Frontal wheel loader with a bucket capacity up to 3.9m3: EUR 50 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Mobile crane - manipulator: EUR 80 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Portal crane with a lifting capacity up to 20t: EUR 80 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Portal crane with a lifting capacity over 60t: EUR 170 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).

source_document: Customs Declaration Report, Latvia Customs Information, EuroBrokers
regulation_detail: Customs Clearance Documents Checklist for Import to Latvia: Commercial Invoice (Original), Packing List, Bill of Lading, Certificate of Origin (if preferential duties), Customs Declaration (Electronic), Import Licenses/Permits (if applicable), Sanitary/Phytosanitary Certificates (if applicable), Documents for Reduced VAT (if applicable).
Pre-Handling Documents Checklist for Ship at ROT Berth: Ships particulars; Bill of Lading (only if Cargo is unloaded); A copy of the ship's International tonnage certificate; Cargo Loading Order.

Post-Handling Documents Checklist for Ship at ROT Berth: Bill of Lading; Statement of facts; Cargo fumigation certificate (if cargo fumigation has been performed); Intermediate/final draft survey; Cargo manifest - 1 copy; Other documents requested by ROT.

source_document: Latvia Customs Information, Customs Declaration Report
regulation_detail: Customs Transit Documents Checklist for Latvia: Power of Attorney, Transport Document (CMR or BL), Commercial Invoice, Customs Transit Services Order, Guarantee Policy.

document_type: Exemption Certificate Application Documents - Humanitarian Aid
regulation_detail: Documents for Duty & Tax Exemption Certificate Application for Humanitarian Aid Imports to Latvia: D&T Exemption Certificate (Original), Invoice (Original), AWB/BL/Other Transport Documents, Donation/Non-Commercial Certificates, Packing Lists, Power of Attorney (original), Certificate of Origin (original), Sanitary border inspection document (if needed), Import/export licenses (if needed), Documents for reduced VAT (if needed).

document_type: Application for Permit for Navigating in Port Water Area (AKOA)
regulation_detail: Documents/Information Required for Application for Permit for Navigating in Port Water Area (AKOA) at Riga Port: Application form (Annex 3), Knowledge Evaluation Test Minutes (Annex 3), Ship Particulars, Vessel Master's Details, and other supporting documents as per Harbour Master requirements.
Riga Container Terminal (RCT) utilizes an Automated Gate Operating System (GOS) for gate operations.
Upon entry at the RCT gate, vehicle recognition is automated via license plate and container Optical Character Recognition (OCR).
Verification at the RCT gate involves RFID tag validation and PIN authentication for truckers.

source_document: Gate Procedures Report, RCT Regulations on Pass Regime
regulation_detail: Detailed gate access procedures for RCT are outlined in the publicly available 'Regulations on the Pass Regime' document published by Riga Container Terminal.
Baltic Container Terminal (BCT) utilizes the NAVIS N4 Terminal Operating System (TOS) for gate and terminal operations.
BCT gate operations are characterized by Fully Automated Container Operations Concept (ACOC) for container processing, minimizing manual data entry.

Riga Universal Terminal (ROT) has implemented full gate automation in 2021, featuring a paperless documentation system, automated license plate recognition, and biometric access control for personnel.

relevant_entity: Import Container, Terminal Operator, Quay Cranes
regulation_detail: Import container handling at Riga Port terminals begins with Vessel Unloading using Ship-to-Shore (STS) cranes to unload containers from vessels.

relevant_entity: Import Container, Terminal Operator, Yard Cranes
regulation_detail: For import containers, Yard Storage is performed using Rubber-Tired Gantry (RTG) cranes to stack containers in designated areas of the terminal yard.
Import containers at Riga Port terminals undergo Customs Clearance procedures if required, with customs operating 24/7 to facilitate the process.
For export containers at Riga Port terminals, Gate-In procedures involve automated systems scanning the container and verifying the trucker's credentials upon truck entry.
Export containers are stored in designated areas within the terminal yard at Riga Port terminals while awaiting vessel arrival.

relevant_entity: Export Container, Terminal Operator, Quay Cranes
regulation_detail: Export container handling concludes with Vessel Loading, where Ship-to-Shore (STS) cranes load containers onto the departing vessel at Riga Port terminals.
Ship-to-Shore (STS) cranes, also known as quay cranes, are used for efficient vessel loading and unloading of containers at Riga Port terminals.
Reach stackers are utilized at Riga Port container terminals for stacking and moving containers within the terminal yard.
Rubber-Tired Gantry (RTG) cranes, also known as yard cranes, are employed for high-density stacking of containers in storage yards at Riga Port terminals.
Terminal tractors and trailers are used for horizontal movement of containers within the terminal area at Riga Port.
Automation, including OCR and RFID technologies, is a key yard management practice at Riga Port terminals for container tracking and management.
Mandatory pre-booking of time slots for gate operations is a yard management practice at Riga Port terminals to optimize traffic flow and reduce gate congestion.

relevant_entity: Terminal Operators, Yard Management, Security Personnel
regulation_detail: Biometric and RFID-based access control for personnel and vehicles are yard management practices implemented for security at Riga Port terminals.
Environmental measures, such as dust suppression systems and wind fences, are yard management practices used at Riga Port terminals to minimize environmental impact.
Forklift with a lifting capacity over 5.0t and up to 10.0t: EUR 45 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Frontal wheel loader with a bucket capacity up to 3.9m3: EUR 50 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Mobile crane - manipulator: EUR 80 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
Portal crane with a lifting capacity up to 20t: EUR 80 per working hour (special tariff for unforeseen ROT Services and downtime).
